results.title: Little big top
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Torben Schioler, ONF | NFB, Bill Brind, Colin Low and Michael McKennirey
results.brief_description: Provides an insight into the magic generated by the Royal Brothers’ Circus, a tent circus of a type that is fast disappearing. Torrential rains, axles sunk in mud, shaky performances, and a monumental tent that must be pulled up and down once a day do not inhibit the fifteen trucks and assorted beasts from travelling around at a rate of one town a day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ianzelo, Torben Schioler, ONF | NFB, Bill Brind, Colin Low and Michael McKennirey

results.title: Little Big Man
results.creator_credit: Stuart Millar, Hiller Productions and Arthur Penn
results.brief_description: Arthur Penn’s adaptation of Thomas Berger’s novel shifts from comedy to drama as it depicts the horrific effects of American Imperialism. 121-year-old Jack Crabb narrates the story as the sole white survivor of the battle of Little Big Horn which saw the fall of General George A. Custer. He recounts his life story beginning with his adoption by Cheyenne Indians, where he was taught to live peacefully with nature. He later finds himself once again in the white world and is taken in by a preacher and his wife for religious education and guidance. He swaps his bible for a gun and be-friends Wild Bill Hickock, only to abandon even that to settle down and marry. Returning to the Cheyenne by chance, Crabb finds that he prefers this life, but is soon made aware of the carnage wreaked by white man. Cast includes: Dusitn Hoffman, Faye Dunaway, Martin Balsam, Richard Mulligan, and Chief Dan George.

results.title: Little Bear: hide and seek
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Nelvana, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Clive A Smith and Raymond Jafelice
results.brief_description: This video contains six delightful adventures of Little Bear, the furry fellow based upon the series of books written by Else Homelund Minarik and illustrated by Maurice Sendak. These animated works with their gentle rhythm and family values will delight the very young as Little Bear and his family and friends go about daily life in the forest. The programs are: “What will Little Bear wear?” Mother Bear teaches Little Bear that the best coat to keep him warm in winter is his own fur. “Hide and seek” a universal game played and enjoyed by Little Bear and his friends Cat, Hen, Duck and Owl. “Little Bear goes to the moon” Little Bear’s imagination takes off as he creates a special moon hat. “Birthday soup” to celebrate his birthday, Little Bear invites the gang over to share in some imaginary soup. “Polar Bear” Little Bear’s fur becomes a different colour after a painting mishap. “Gone Fishing” Little Bear goes fishing but takes his imagination with him.

results.title: Little athletics: sprinting
results.creator_credit: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane
results.brief_description: Skills and exercises needed for successful sprinting are explained and demonstrated in this film. These include techniques of body movement, relaxation and also the methods of starting and running the race. This film is interspersed with some shots of Australian women sprinters. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Little athletics: long jump
results.creator_credit: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane
results.brief_description: Two young athletes are coached in the techniques of long jump. Shows both the sail jump, popular with young jumpers, and the hitch kick used by most successful long jumpers. Demonstrates exercises to build up the long jumper’s strength and flexibility. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane

results.title: Little athletics: hurdling
results.creator_credit: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane
results.brief_description: The stages of learning to hurdle are explained and demonstrated. Specific exercises for hurdlers are shown along with more general exercises from which all young athletes could benefit. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Little athletics: high jump
results.creator_credit: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane
results.brief_description: A young athlete is taught the Fosbury Flop. The run-up, take-off and landing are explained in detail. Includes a series of exercises relevant to high-jump. Gordon Windewyer, an Australian and Commonwealth champion, is seen in action using the Fosbury Flop. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane

results.title: Little athletics: discus throwing
results.creator_credit: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane
results.brief_description: Alan Launder coaches two athletes through the initial stages of discus throwing. A more advanced technique is demonstrated which is applicable to senior athletes. Safety measures are stressed for class teaching. Exercises to help build up strength and flexibility have been included. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane
